wifindus

Class MySQLConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • wifindus.MySQLConnection
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EyeMySQLConnection

    public class MySQLConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper around MySQL's Connector/J.
    Author:
    Mark 'marzer' Gillard

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public final void connect(java.lang.String address,
           int port,
           java.lang.String database,
           java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Connects to a MySQL database.
        Parameters:
        address - Address of the server (without port).
        port - The port on which to connect.
        database - The name of the database to connect to.
        username - The MySQL server username.
        password - The MySQL server password.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the driver could not be loaded, if a connection already exists, or if the connection failed.

      • connect

        public final void connect(java.lang.String address,
           java.lang.String database,
           java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Connects to a MySQL database on port 3306.
        Parameters:
        address - Address of the server (without port).
        database - The name of the database to connect to.
        username - The MySQL server username.
        password - The MySQL server password.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the driver could not be loaded, if a connection already exists, or if the connection failed.

      • connect

        public final void connect(java.lang.String database,
           java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Connects to a MySQL database at localhost:3306.
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to connect to.
        username - The MySQL server username.
        password - The MySQL server password.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the driver could not be loaded, if a connection already exists, or if the connection failed.

      • disconnect

        public final void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the database, freeing the connection resources. If you have any ResultSets, Statements or PreparedStatements cached, you should call release() on them before disconnecting.

      • release

        public final void release(java.sql.Statement... statements)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Frees the resources used by the given Statements or PreparedStatements.
        Parameters:
        statements - One or more Statement objects to release.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If no MySQL connection has been established.

      • release

        public final void release(java.sql.ResultSet... resultSets)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Frees the resources used by the given ResultSets.
        Parameters:
        resultSets - One or more ResultSet objects to release.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If no MySQL connection has been established.

      • createStatement

        public final java.sql.Statement createStatement()
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Creates a Statement object using the MySQL connection.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If no MySQL connection has been established or if an error occurs.

      • prepareStatement

        public final java.sql.PreparedStatement prepareStatement(java.lang.String query)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Creates a PreparedStatement object using the MySQL connection.
        Parameters:
        query - The SQL query to execute.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If no MySQL connection has been established or if an error occurs.

      • getNullableDouble

        public static final java.lang.Double getNullableDouble(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                                 java.lang.String columnLabel)
                                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets a nullable Double value, properly enforcing null returns in the case of SQL NULL.
        Parameters:
        resultSet - The set of query results from which to get the nullable value.
        columnLabel - The name of the column holding the value
        Returns:
        A Double containing the given value, or null if it was SQL NULL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an SQL error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if resultSet or columnLabel are null.

      • getNullableInt

        public static final java.lang.Integer getNullableInt(java.sql.ResultSet resultSet,
                               java.lang.String columnLabel)
                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets a nullable Integer value, properly enforcing null returns in the case of SQL NULL.
        Parameters:
        resultSet - The set of query results from which to get the nullable value.
        columnLabel - The name of the column holding the value
        Returns:
        An Integer containing the given value, or null if it was SQL NULL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an SQL error occurs.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if resultSet or columnLabel are null.
